alert.note: Alert for Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 6:50AM CST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a combination of rain, snowmelt and heavy river ice continues. * WHERE...Along the Kankakee River from Kankakee River State Park downstream to near the Grundy/Will county line, including portions of Grundy and Will counties. * WHEN...Until further notice * IMPACTS...Flooding of roads and streets will continue. Yards and other low-lying areas will remain inundated by water and ice. Shifting ice may damage structures along the shore. Water levels will remain high over the weekend due to high streamflow resulting from a combination of recent rains and snowmelt. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 640 AM CST, river gauge data indicates that river levels have dropped several feet since last night and continue to fall while remaining in flood stage. Flash flood warnings for this ice jam break have been cancelled. However, residual flooding will persist. Additionally, fluctuations in river levels will be possible as residual upstream ice moves through the area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Warning means flooding is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers, creeks, and other waterways should take immediate precautions to protect life and property.
